title-group.article-title: Maj. Gen. Theresa C. Carter, P.E., USAF

bio.p: Maj. Gen. Theresa C. Carter, P.E., USAF, became The Air Force Civil Engineer and Deputy Chief of Staff for Logistics, Installations and Mission Support, HQ U.S. Air Force, in June 2013. Gen. Carter entered the Air Force in September 1985 as a distinguished graduate of the Air Force ROTC program at Purdue University. A career civil engineer, she has served in a variety of positions at the base, major command and Air Staff levels, and commanded a civil engineer squadron, mission support group and two air base wings. Her contingency experience includes service in support of Operation Desert Shield, and command of a civil engineer unit in support of Operation Southern Watch. Before being named The Civil Engineer, she commanded the 8,000-person 502nd Air Base Wing and Joint Base San Antonio, the largest joint base in the Department of Defense. Gen. Carter earned a Master of Science in Industrial Engineering from the University of Oklahoma and also holds a Master of Science in National Resource Strategy from the Industrial College of the Armed Forces, Fort McNair, Washington, D.C.
